replies.author: er1cthe0ne

replies.bodyText:
Current neutron doesn't have support on VXLAN-GPE


OVS should support VxLan-GPE already. The OVS commit for GPE support: https://openii.cn/openvswitch/ovs/commit/439f39cb9bd7214d1f70c317420cb2d33556296f
As Neutron doesn't support VxLan-GPE, actually this is a good opportunity for Alcor. VxLan-GPE is more like a DP term but we could check what's required for CP to support the new tunneling technology.
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
I have added VxLAN-GPE option now after seeing the advantages: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/cether/configuration/xe-16/ce-xe-16-book/vxlan-gpe-tunnel.html
Here is my analysis to support vxlan-gpe:

VM will not need to know that tunnel type is used
Agent will need to create the additional vxlan-gpe port during setup/init
Agent will use the new vxlan-gpe port if NetworkType = VXLAN-GPE send down from Controller
E2E functional testing and automated test code
I don't see other changes needed unless we start leverage the vxlan-gpe specific features

We can say Alcor will have preliminary or proposed future support for VxLan-GPE. Thoughts?
replies.author: er1cthe0ne

replies.bodyText: Sounds like a plan. One more question before we call it good: Can VxLan-GPE VNI overlap with "regular" VxLan VNI? Will this cause conflict on the host?
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: My understanding is yes, the VxLan-GPE can use the same setup of VNI since it is backward compatible with VxLan. The official VxLan-GPE draft said VxLan-GPE vtep would detect if the other side is VxLan only then it would use VxLan encap header format. However, on the topic of how to detect vtep can support VxLan-GPE or it is VxLan only, the draft said it is out of scope...
replies.author: er1cthe0ne

timeline.bodyText:
That is right. MTU will be on vpc level.
Does this mean that they will use the same MTU on a region basis and ignore MTU value from Neutron Server.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: The MTU setting depends on the physical NIC MTU setting and all the networking hardware needs to support it (e.g. jumbo frame MTU=9000). Therefore, we cannot simply allow a VPC to set certain MTU. More detail here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/cc69828ff09f5dbc37488f3f56bb045772e35634/doc/source/admin/config-mtu.rst#L7
replies.author: er1cthe0ne
xieus

replies.bodyText: Looking deeper into MTU in neutron code, while it is not being used in ovs neutron agent where it is configuring ports created by nova agent, MTU setting are being used in dvr edge router (for source NAT), dvr floating IP management and neutron L3 agent (I am guessing it is because these component will create (e.g. gateway) ports). We will need to look into MTU topic more when we design our router.
replies.author: er1cthe0ne

replies.bodyText: I see. Let us keep this field for now which allows us to revisit for L3 networking staff shortly.
